intro: Luisia acutilabris, commonly known as the sharp-edged luisia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and pointed, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. The plant's flowers are usually pink or purple, adding a subtle ornamental value to its natural habitat.
